text: John Claude Bidgood (12 May 1914 – 17 August 2001) was a British Conservative Party politician. He was elected at the 1955 general election as Member of Parliament (MP) for Bury and Radcliffe. Bidgood was re-elected at the 1959 election, but at the 1964 general election he lost his seat to Labour's David Ensor. == References == * == External links == * Category:1914 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Category:UK MPs 1955–1959 Category:UK MPs 1959–1964
title: John Bidgood
